pr_title: Cleanly Handle S3 SDK Exceptions in Request Counting

timeline.message:
Cleanly Handle S3 SDK Exceptions in Request Counting

It looks like it is possible for a request to throw an exception early
before any API interaciton has happened. This can lead to the request count
map containing a `null` for the request count key.
The assertion is not correct and we should not NPE here
(as that might also hide the original exception since we are running this code in
a `finally` block from within the S3 SDK).

Closes #61670

timeline.bodyText: This has never happened on Cloud ever and I believe the original issue reporting this is likely some error with the credentials or an S3 SDK bug (can't reproduce it) but I still think we should log it as we really only get here if there's a problem.
timeline.author: original-brownbear

replies.bodyText: Yes, that seems strange. I took a quick glance to the SDK code and it seems like AWSRequestMetrics is created before the request is executed 🤔 as long as the collector is enabled for that request.
replies.author: fcofdez

replies.bodyText:
seems like AWSRequestMetrics is created before the request is executed thinking

The problem is that the counter is only there if an actual request was executed. Now if there is some bug (like we had before with an NPE in some URL utility method in the SDK) or legitmate exception (maybe from auth/signing) before that we never get the expected counter itself.
replies.author: original-brownbear
